official_title: To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to ensure that human tissue intended for transplantation is safe and effective, and for other purposes.
short_title: Human Tissue for Transplantation Act of 1993
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Human Tissue for Transplantation Act of 1993 - Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to provide for the regulation of human tissue banks and tissue banking practices. Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a Tissue Advisory Committee for advice on standards and regulations. Provides for the use of tissue bank permit fees to cover costs of implementing this Act. Prohibits the Secretary from enforcing existing regulations that treat human heart valves as medical devices subject to premarket approval. Rescinds the determination by the Secretary that human heart valves must undergo premarket approval.

titles.title: Human Tissue for Transplantation Act of 1993
To amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to ensure that human tissue intended for transplantation is safe and effective, and for other purposes.
